title: Daily Reminder People Can Hold You Hostage in Champ Select
body: It's 2017 and we still have no way to report someone for ruining our game before it even starts. The only solution they really give us is to dodge, but that doesn't solve anything. They still get away with being a child and ruining the game for at least 4 other players.

More often than not I'm one to dig my heels in and stick it out through the game so that I can report the toddler... but others don't usually feel the same. I've often lost the opportunity to report these hostage-holding players because one of my teammates didn't want to deal with them for the duration of the match.

All that Riot can justifiably do about the situation is to improve the systems or make it easier to track player behavior in champion select even when dodges occur. And to better enforce against hostage takers in those situations.

But I don't know if this is more or less practical than just taking reports from players after champion select ends or gets dodged.

Seeing as Riot Meddler specifically stated that they care about hostage holding champion select, I'd say that they actually do.

"Working on a solution" is how the world works. Large systems take time to get into motion. Bureaucracies are slow to change, and companies with limited resources cannot drop everything to try to fix a single problem in one attempt.

Take a second to imagine the amount of support tickets they receive, I'll give you a hint: it's over 100 thousand in less than an hour. And that's not even at peak times. There's probably a massive number of those that are reports of trolls and toxic players. Regardless of the %, even a small amount is still going to be a large amount throughout the course of an entire day. They cannot just stop and respond in-depth to every player who reaches out to them, they've even said they tried that before and it was impossible to maintain.

tldr; Give them time, things aren't magically fixed overnight. And it's more practical for them to take their time coming up with the right solution rather than run around putting out fires so much that they can't even work on anything else as well.

An idea I had is to add the ability to report someone in champ select.  2 or more people have to report them.  When this happens, the lobby is canceled just like a dodge and no one gets punished immediately.  The case is reviewed, yes, reviewed and not automated to determine the validity of the report.  Someone is punished every single time.  The person who was reported is punished if they are found guilty and the people who reported are punished if they are found innocent.  The second part is to prevent false reports just from seeing people's match history or an off meta pick.  The standard punishment would be 20 minute low priority queue.
